page.title: 03Religion.
page.content: There are two places of Worship in our area,Maesyronnen Chapel (U.R.C.)and St Meilig's Church, Llowes. {Maesyronnen,}built in 1696 is one of the earliest chapels in Wales.Despite its secluded position it is still very active,with weekly services attended by about 20 people and monthly bible study,prayer,business and social meetings.For communion,members sit around an oak table with the minister at the head.18th century pewter cups & plate are used.Box family pews and backless benches are also in use. {St.Meilig's Church}was rebuilt in 1853 St Meilig's 7ft.stone slab cross and 13th century stone font, are at the rear.The register shows that about 8 people attend each Sunday with 2 funerals and 1 wedding per year.They need Â£10,000 for repairs. These 2 places attract many visitors.
